description: Unique identifier for each cost record.
comment: Primary Key for the COST table.

description: Identifier of the clinical event record associated with this cost record.
comment: Links cost to the corresponding event in the specified cost_domain_id.

description: Domain of the associated clinical event (e.g., Condition, Drug, Procedure, Visit).
Represents the type of cost (e.g., billed charge, paid amount).
Represents the currency of the monetary amounts recorded in this table.
Total amount charged for the service or item.
Total cost incurred for the service or item.
Total amount paid for the service or item.
comment: Sum of payments from all sources.

description: Amount paid by the payer.
Amount paid by the patient.
Amount paid by the patient as copay.
Amount paid by the patient as coinsurance.
Amount paid by the patient toward deductible.
Amount paid by the primary payer.
Ingredient cost paid (typically for drugs).
Dispensing fee paid (typically for drugs).
Identifier of the payer plan period associated with this cost record.
Maximum reimbursable amount allowed by the payer.
Concept representing the revenue code for billing classification.
Revenue codes are a method to charge for a class of procedures and conditions in the U.S. hospital system.
Concept representing the Diagnosis Related Group classification.
Diagnosis Related Groups are US codes used to classify hospital cases into one of approximately 500 groups.
